text: Robert LeGrand Backman (March 22, 1922 - June 3, 2022) was an American lawyer and politician. He was a general authority of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church) from 1978 until his death. He was born in Salt Lake City, Utah. He was also a member of the First Quorum of the Seventy between 1978 until 1992. From 2005 to 2008, Backman was president of the church's Jordan River Utah Temple."New temple presidents", Deseret News, 20 August 2005. Retrieved on 24 March 2020. Backman died in Holladay, Utah on June 3, 2022, at the age of 100. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Lawyers from Salt Lake City, Utah Category:Politicians from Salt Lake City, Utah Category:American centenarians
title: Robert L. Backman
